division_1.description: NCAA Division I has the most stringent eligibility requirements
amateur_status_rules: Cannot sign a contract with a professional team
Cannot receive salary or payment to play
Cannot compete on a professional team
Cannot receive benefits from an agent or prospective agent
Can receive actual and necessary expenses
Name, Image, and Likeness (NIL) deals are permitted with restrictions

timeline.freshman_year: Begin taking core courses; focus on strong academic foundation
timeline.sophomore_year: Continue core courses; research NCAA requirements
timeline.junior_year: Register with NCAA Eligibility Center; take SAT/ACT; start recruitment process
timeline.senior_year: Complete core courses; request final transcript; finalize recruitment

division_2.description: NCAA Division II has somewhat less stringent requirements than D1

timeline.freshman_year: Focus on academics; explore sports opportunities
timeline.sophomore_year: Continue core courses; begin researching D2 schools
timeline.junior_year: Register with NCAA Eligibility Center; take SAT/ACT

division_3.description: NCAA Division III does not offer athletic scholarships and follows school admission standards
division_3.notes: Division III schools do not offer athletic scholarships. Eligibility is based on each school's admission requirements. Athletes must be accepted as students first. Academic aid and merit scholarships may be available based on academic achievement.
division_3.scholarships: No athletic scholarships; academic and need-based aid available

timeline.junior_year: Research D3 schools; begin communication with coaches
timeline.senior_year: Apply to schools; complete admission process

naia.notes: NAIA schools can offer athletic scholarships. Must register with NAIA Eligibility Center.

divisions.division_2: Can offer partial scholarships (tuition and fees)

juco.requirements: Must be a high school graduate or have GED. Individual schools set academic requirements.
juco.notes: JUCO can be a path to 4-year schools. Maintains eligibility for transfer.

freshman_year: Focus on academics and take challenging courses
Participate in sports at school and club level
sophomore_year: Continue strong academics; maintain core course progress
Build relationships with high school and club coaches
junior_year: Register with NCAA Eligibility Center (if D1/D2)
This is the most active recruiting year for most sports
senior_year: Request official transcript to NCAA Eligibility Center
Sign National Letter of Intent during appropriate signing period

recruitment_timeline.dead_periods: Times when coaches cannot have contact with recruits
recruitment_timeline.contact_periods: Times when coaches can have face-to-face contact
recruitment_timeline.evaluation_periods: Times when coaches can watch you compete but not speak off-campus

core_gpa_notes: Only NCAA-approved core courses count toward core GPA

approved_core_courses.notes: Each high school has a list of NCAA-approved core courses. Check the NCAA Eligibility Center for your school's list.
